sanskrit_verse: सूर्येण ह्यभिनिर्मुक्तः शयानोऽभ्युदितश्च यः । अभिनिम्लुक्तः प्रायश्चित्तमकुर्वाणो युक्तः स्यान् महतेनसा ॥ २.२२१॥
transliteration: sūryeṇa hy abhinirmuktaḥ śayāno 'bhyuditaś ca yaḥ | abhinimluktaḥ prāyaścittam akurvāṇo yuktaḥ syān mahatena sā || 2.221||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who sleeps or wakes facing away from the sun without performing prescribed restorative acts becomes aligned with great sin due to disruption of natural energetic harmony.

Restoration logic requires realignment through conscious directional rectification
Consciousness alignment is achieved via solar-oriented behavioral correction

supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, the threshold of responsibility lies in verified intent and habitual repetition of solar-directional avoidance. The hierarchy recognizes that awareness once gained obligates immediate rectification. Restoration prevails through mandatory solar-sync protocols rather than punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes causal link between directional neglect and energetic imbalance. Non-punitive reality rule ensures correction through solar resonance, not suffering.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: Dharma is restored through solar-directional realignment; reality operates without punishment; consciousness alone adjudicates all action.
